iso_retirement.name: Buxinhua
iso_retirement.comment:
As best as I can tell, these refer to the same language from two different
sources. The bgk information seems to have originally come from J-O Svantesson,
whereas the Buxinhua information is originally from the Encyclopedic Dictionary
of Chinese Linguistics. "Bit" and "Buxin(g)hua" appear to refer to the same
small language in Yunnan province's Mengla county which Chinese linguists (e.g.
Shearer & Sun 2002) classify as Khmuic. As bgk is linked to speakers in Laos, it
seems simpler to retire bxt.
